alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 2:52AM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Illinois... Fox River at Dayton affecting La Salle County. For the Fox River (Illinois)...including Dayton...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Near bankfull conditions and flooding caused by an ice jam are expected. * WHERE...Fox River at and near Dayton. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, the river begins to overflow banks in the lowest areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 10.8 feet. Also at 2:00 AM CST, emergency management reported that some ice had broken free from an ice jam near the Dayton Dam. Some of this ice was recollecting downstream along the Fox River in Ottawa. Minor flooding of the Fox River Park had been reported. In addition, there remains a large amount of ice upstream of the Dayton Dam up to Wedron. With ongoing river rises due to Tuesday`s rainfall, there may continue to be some immediate riverside flooding of low-lying areas due to ice jams. - Forecast...If any solid ice jams are reported that would induce greater flooding, a river Flood Warning for the lower Fox River will be issued. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by noon today.
